cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 470 miles ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest north of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest into the eastern Gulf of Mexico, then head toward Florida’s Big Bend and the southeastern U.S.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast near Apalachicola/Cedar Key

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Bonita Beach south and east to Ocean Reef, including the Florida Keys and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southwest and west-central Florida coast from the Keys northward through Tampa Bay and the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Increasing northeasterly to easterly winds late Sunday into Monday, with a 22 % chance of sustained 34-kt (39 mph) winds and gusts possibly 45–50 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in and near Tampa Bay during Sunday night high tides.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches Sunday–Monday could cause urban and small-stream flooding at the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas, hazardous marine conditions, and dangerous rip currents beginning late Saturday.
